intro: Echium humile subsp. pycnanthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its small, glandular leaves and compact inflorescences are adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
